table_description: DigitalOcean Block Storage Volumes provide expanded storage capacity for your Droplets and can be moved between Droplets within a specific region. Volumes function as raw block devices, meaning they appear to the operating system as locally attached storage which can be formatted using any file system supported by the OS.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the block storage volume.

columns.name: name
columns.description: A human-readable name for the block storage volume. Must be lowercase and be composed only of numbers, letters and \"-\", up to a limit of 64 characters. The name must begin with a letter.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Time when the block storage volume was created.

columns.name: description
columns.description: An optional free-form text field to describe a block storage volume.

columns.name: droplet_ids
columns.description: An array containing the IDs of the Droplets the volume is attached to. Note that at this time, a volume can only be attached to a single Droplet.

columns.name: filesystem_label
columns.description: The label currently applied to the filesystem.

columns.name: filesystem_type
columns.description: The type of filesystem currently in-use on the volume.

columns.name: region_slug
columns.description: The unique slug identifier for the region the volume is deployed in.

columns.name: region_name
columns.description: The name of the region the volume is deployed in.

columns.name: size_gigabytes
columns.description: The size of the block storage volume in GiB (1024^3).

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: An array of tags the volume has been tagged with

columns.name: urn
columns.description: The uniform resource name (URN) for the volume.
